contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox martial art | logo = | logosize = | image = naban2005.jpg | imagecaption = | imagesize = 140px | name = Naban | aka = | focus = [[Grappling]] | country = {{flag|Myanmar}} | parenthood = [[Malla-yuddha]] | creator = | famous_pract = | olympic = No }} [[Image:Fauchage hanche naban.jpg|thumb]] '''Naban''' ({{lang-my|နပန်း}}, {{IPA-my|nəbáɴ|pron}}) is the traditional form of wrestling from [[Myanmar]]. Originally based on [[malla-yuddha|Indian wrestling]],<ref name="Draeger">{{cite book |title=Comprehensive Asian Fighting Arts |author=[[Donn F. Draeger]] and Robert W. Smith |publisher=Kodansha |year=1969 |isbn=978-0-87011-436-6}}</ref> it is practiced primarily in rural areas. Naban is especially popular among the Himalayan tribes. The [[Chin people|Chin]] and [[Kachin people]] are both known for their skilled wrestlers.<ref name="Draeger"/> Techniques include [[joint lock]]s, strikes to [[pressure point]]s, and [[chokehold]]s. Any part of the opponent's body is a legal target. ==Internal links== *[[Bando]] *[[Banshay]] *[[Lethwei]] *[[Khmer traditional wrestling]] *[[Malla-yuddha]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{folk wrestling}} {{grappling}} [[Category:Burmese martial arts]] [[Category:Sport in Burma]] [[Category:Combat sports]] [[Category:Burmese words and phrases]] {{martialart-stub}} {{Burma-sport-stub}}
